member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.GASemivariogramSensitivity
member.summary: This tool performs a sensitivity analysis on the predicted values and associated standard errors by changing the model's semivariogram parameters (the nugget, partial sill, and major/minor ranges) within a percentage of the original values. The tool takes a geostatistical model source in order to populate these initial values of the nugget, partial sill, and major/minor ranges. The tool's output is a table indicating which parameter values were used and what the resulting predicted and standard error values were. If there are large fluctuations in the output with small changes in the model's parameter values, then you cannot have much confidence in the output. On the other hand, if changes in the output are small, then you can be confident in the model's predictions and make decisions based on its output.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.GASemivariogramSensitivity.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The geostatistical model source to be analyzed. (In, Required)
A GeostatisticalDatasets object. (In, Required)
Point locations where the sensitivity analysis is performed. (In, Required)
Table storing the sensitivity results. (Out, Required)

member.summary: The geostatistical model source to be analyzed. (In, Required)

member.summary: A GeostatisticalDatasets object. (In, Required)

member.summary: Point locations where the sensitivity analysis is performed. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.GaussianGeostatisticalSimulations.in_bounding_dataset
member.summary: Limits the analysis to these features' bounding polygon. If point features are entered, then a convex hull polygon is automatically created. Realizations are then performed within that polygon. If bounding features are supplied, any features or rasters supplied in the Mask environment will be ignored. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The threshold value for which the output raster will be generated, as the percentage of the number of times the set threshold was exceeded, on a cell-by-cell basis. (In, Optional)

member.summary: These polygons represent areas of interest for which summary statistics are calculated. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.GaussianGeostatisticalSimulations.raster_stat_type
member.summary: The simulated rasters are postprocessed on a cell-by-cell basis, and each selected statistics type is calculated and reported in an output raster. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.GaussianGeostatisticalSimulations.conditioning_measurement_error_field
member.summary: A field that specifies the measurement error for each input point in the conditioning features. For each conditioning feature, the value of this field should correspond to one standard deviation of the measured value of the feature. Use this field if the measurement error values are not the same at each sampling location. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.IDW
member.summary: Uses the measured values surrounding the prediction location to predict a value for any unsampled location, based on the assumption that things that are close to one another are more alike than those that are farther apart.

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input point features containing the z-values to be interpolated. (In, Required)

member.summary: The input point features containing the z-values to be interpolated. (In, Required)

member.summary: Field that holds a height or magnitude value for each point. This can be a numeric field or the Shape field if the input features contain z-values or m-values. (In, Required)

member.summary: The geostatistical layer produced. This layer is required output only if no output raster is requested. (Out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.IDW.out_raster
member.summary: The output raster. This raster is required output only if no output geostatistical layer is requested. (Out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.IDW.cell_size
member.summary: The cell size at which the output raster will be created. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.IDW.power
member.summary: The exponent of distance that controls the significance of surrounding points on the interpolated value. A higher power results in less influence from distant points. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.IDW.search_neighborhood
member.summary: Defines which surrounding points will be used to control the output. Standard is the default. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Used to emphasize an observation. The larger the weight, the more impact it has on the prediction. For coincident observations, assign the largest weight to the most reliable measurement. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Option to control the creation of prediction and prediction standard errors where the predictions are unstable. This option is only available for polynomials of order 1, 2, and 3. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.LocalPolynomialInterpolation.condition_number
member.summary: Every invertible square matrix has a condition number that indicates how inaccurate the solution to the linear equations can be with a small change in the matrix coefficients (it can be due to imprecise data). If the condition number is large, a small change in the matrix coefficients results in a large change in the solution vector. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Used to emphasize an observation. The larger the weight, the more impact it has on the prediction. For coincident observations, assign the largest weight to the most reliable measurement. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.DiffusionInterpolationWithBarriers.number_iterations

The larger this number, the more accurate the predictions, yet the longer the processing time. The more complex the barrier's geometry and the larger the bandwidth, the more iterations are required for accurate predictions. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.RadialBasisFunctions.small_scale_parameter
member.summary: Used to calculate the weights assigned to the points located in the moving window. Each of the radial basis functions has a parameter that controls the degree of small-scale variation of the surface. The (optimal) parameter is determined by finding the value that minimizes the root mean square prediction error (RMSPE). (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.CreateSpatiallyBalancedPoints
member.summary: Generates a set of sample points based on inclusion probabilities, resulting in a spatially balanced sample design. This tool is generally used for designing a monitoring network by suggesting locations to take samples, and a preference for particular locations can be defined using an inclusion probability raster.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.CreateSpatiallyBalancedPoints.#ctor(System.Object,System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: This raster defines the inclusion probabilities for each location in the area of interest. The location values range from 0 (low inclusion probability) to 1 (high inclusion probability). (In, Required)
Specify how many sample locations to generate. (In, Required)
The output feature class contains the selected sample locations and their inclusion probabilities. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.CreateSpatiallyBalancedPoints.in_probability_raster
member.summary: This raster defines the inclusion probabilities for each location in the area of interest. The location values range from 0 (low inclusion probability) to 1 (high inclusion probability). (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.CreateSpatiallyBalancedPoints.number_output_points
member.summary: Specify how many sample locations to generate. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.CreateSpatiallyBalancedPoints.out_feature_class
member.summary: The output feature class contains the selected sample locations and their inclusion probabilities. (Out, Required)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.ExtractValuesToTable
member.summary: Extracts cell values from a set of rasters to a table, based on a point or polygon feature class.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.ExtractValuesToTable.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The points or polygon features to be created. (In, Required)
The rasters must all have the same extent, coordinate system, and cell size. (In, Required)

The output table contains a record for each point and each raster that has data. If polygon features are input, they are converted to points that coincide with the raster cell centers. (Out, Required)

member.summary: The points or polygon features to be created. (In, Required)

member.summary: The rasters must all have the same extent, coordinate system, and cell size. (In, Required)

member.summary: The output table contains a record for each point and each raster that has data. If polygon features are input, they are converted to points that coincide with the raster cell centers. (Out, Required)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.EmpiricalBayesianKriging
member.summary: Empirical Bayesian kriging is an interpolation method that accounts for the error in estimating the underlying semivariogram through repeated simulations.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.EmpiricalBayesianKriging.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input point features containing the z-values to be interpolated. (In, Required)
Field that holds a height or magnitude value for each point. This can be a numeric field or the Shape field if the input features contain z-values or m-values. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.EmpiricalBayesianKriging.in_features
member.summary: The input point features containing the z-values to be interpolated. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.EmpiricalBayesianKriging.z_field
member.summary: Field that holds a height or magnitude value for each point. This can be a numeric field or the Shape field if the input features contain z-values or m-values. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.EmpiricalBayesianKriging.out_ga_layer
member.summary: The geostatistical layer produced. This layer is required output only if no output raster is requested. (Out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.EmpiricalBayesianKriging.out_raster
member.summary: The output raster. This raster is required output only if no output geostatistical layer is requested. (Out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.EmpiricalBayesianKriging.cell_size
member.summary: The cell size at which the output raster will be created. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.EmpiricalBayesianKriging.transformation_type
member.summary: Type of transformation to be applied to the input data. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.EmpiricalBayesianKriging.max_local_points
member.summary: The input data will automatically be divided into groups that do not have more than this number of points. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.EmpiricalBayesianKriging.overlap_factor
member.summary: A factor representing the degree of overlap between local models (also called subsets). Each input point can fall into several subsets, and the overlap factor specifies the average number of subsets that each point will fall into. A high value of the overlap factor makes the output surface smoother, but it also increases processing time. Typical values vary between 0.01 and 5. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.EmpiricalBayesianKriging.number_semivariograms
member.summary: The number of simulated semivariograms of each local model. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.EmpiricalBayesianKriging.search_neighborhood
member.summary: Defines which surrounding points will be used to control the output. Standard Circular is the default. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.EmpiricalBayesianKriging.output_type
member.summary: Surface type to store the interpolation results. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.EmpiricalBayesianKriging.quantile_value
member.summary: The quantile value for which the output raster will be generated. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.EmpiricalBayesianKriging.threshold_type
member.summary: Specifies whether to calculate the probability of exceeding or not exceeding the specified threshold. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.EmpiricalBayesianKriging.probability_threshold
member.summary: The probability threshold value. If left empty, the median (50th quantile) of the input data will be used. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.GeostatisticalAnalystTools.EmpiricalBayesianKriging.semivariogram_model_type
member.summary: The semivariogram model that will be used for the interpolation. (In, Optional)
